title: Cowboy Junkies 1998-09-19 @ Savings Bank Music Hall - Troy, NY
description:
As I&#039;ve been creating this page, I&#039;ve been listening to this show in detail for the first time. It&#039;s actually quite wonderful, and from the sound it seems it was intimate. Listen to Margo tell her story of a Starbucks visit in New York City before the band plays "A Common Disaster." When she introduces "Bea&#039;s Song (River Song Trilogy: part II), she says, "This is another song from the Lay It Down album. It&#039;s probably my favorite song to sing from that album," and before she can go on a woman in the audience yells "Bea&#039;s Song!" Margo sort of chuckles and says, "That&#039;s right!" It&#039;s wonderful to hear that sort of interaction, and very rare these days in our era or prepackaged artists.

 

This tour was in support of the "Miles from Our Home" album, a very underrated release. They did some interesting material off that album, like "Darkling Days," and a slightly mellower version of "Blue Guitar." This show also includes my favorite song off that album, "No Birds Today." Margo says that "Good Friday" is her favorite song to sing from the album before playing it.


The sound quality of the recording is mostly good, although you can hear some clipping during the latter half of "Lost My Driving Wheel" and "Hunted." Otherwise, I think it really captures the hall and what sounds like an incredibly intimate performance, one I wish I had been at!

 

I think this show is quite an lovely undiscovered gem; I hope you feel the same.
